author: A_Brickset_user
review:
The SP-Striker is the only Light and Sound model out of the Space Police I series as well as their enemies, Blacktron I. 

First off, as always, Space Police I ships are missing engines. That gives the ship a lopsided feel as it is heavily armed (six lasers) in the front. There is the usual jail cell complete with a Blacktron I figure.n This can be removed, and once two hinges are pushed down near the battery pack, the entire battery pack, attached computer, and upper wing assembly can be removed. 

The extended canopy is reminiscent of Blacktron I's Battrax. Inside are two computers, one being a  light-up, which is coupled with the six lights in the upper wings. These can be set to blink on and off or remain constant. The four wings give a good fighter look, and the lower two can be folded down while in flight.

author: mcicero7
title: Highly underated
review:
This set never seemed to gain the attention it deserved.

Not only does it have the only light-up computer piece Lego ever put out, but the solid construction makes for high playability. Overall design is fairly simple with plenty of options for modifications. Engines can be added to the based or under the front laser assemblies, the adjustable wings also could do with some engines.  Lasers can be enhanced with more modern pieces but as it stands it fits in very nicely with the other first generation Space Police sets. More than anything else though it serves as a great step up from the Galactic Peace Keeper (6886). 

If you can find one, which isn't easy anymore, it is definitely worth it.

author: hustla187
title: The Best Space Police Set
review: Out of all the original Space Police sets, this one is the best. The lighting piece is very cool and also fun to play with. The design of this set is fanstastic and is a must own for Space Police fans. This is the best Space Police set by far, and can't be compared.

author: andy87
title: great starfighter!
review:
It resembles the peacekeeper a bit, but this one is larger. Again, it includes one of the special, switchable jail cells. Well i don't care for light up effects, these can be pretty cool, although similiar are used later in blacktron II, which doesn't make much sense. The cockpit of this ship is brilliantly designed and well thought up.

4.8/5

author: fff
title: Lights! Camera! Action! Best of Space Police
review:
This is one of the most special Space Police set. Despite not being the largest ship Space Police, it is very unusual because it has lights. And of course work. The lights module fits within the skeleton of the ship.

Ligths have 2 position: Intermitent & permanent

Great because also its modularity is very curious, because the modules are not to put together but to fit within one in another, the small into the big one. Also we can not forget the prisoner's cell, which is attached at the stern of the ship.

The colours seem to me still to this day highly attractive, black and blue with the trans red.

2 minifigs are included, the policeman and the blacktron. The pieces are very interesting too.

It is worth a reasonable amount of money.

Please see photos:

http://ligandoladrillos.blogspot.com/2010/02/lego-6781-sp-striker.html

author: middlerealm
title: The Best of the Space Police!
review:
I had this set when I was a kid and it was the pride of my entire collection!

There is very little wrong with this kit; movable wings, detachable jail cell, lots of guns, 2 cool minifigs (Blacktron 1 figs were so much cooler than their neon follow-ons). It simply looks amazing, and for those complaining that the lights are 'too much', trust me, when you have the ship built up and in your hands, flick on the switch and bear witness to its awsomeness! The lights are the cherry on top of an incredible looking set. It also lent itself very well to rebuilding into other models, something that the smaller sets were not too hot at. With this set, the possibilities are endless!

I am currently trying to find one of these since, as many of us did, I gave away all of my lego when i hit my late teens. Now I'm wishing I didn't as this set is incredibly hard to find now.

author: SP_Striker
title: One of the best Lego Space sets of all time!
review:
This has got to be my favorite Lego set.

Pros

  • Classic - This set embodies all the good of Lego Space from the 80's

  • Perfect Size - The set is just the right size it does not take all day to assemble and it is easily swooshable with one hand. 

  • Highly Unique Parts - The light up sections are just awesome, and to my knowledge this is the only set to feature a light up control panel.
  • Good Playability - Plenty of movable parts, the light-up feature, as mentioned, and the modular prison pods for the Blacktron figure all add to the fun and interactivity with other space sets.

Cons

  • Just 2 Minifigs- They probably could have fit a second police officer in the cockpit.

  • Not much else wrong with this set....


The Space Police and Blacktron factions really had excellent color combinations going on.

The two factions were really the first 'goodguys' 'badguys' of the space theme series so this added to the sense of conflict. The Space Police Striker seems like it was really the primary fighter of the Space Police fleet and it could pack quite a punch in hunting down and capturing the Blacktron rogues.
